files.description: Provides the single authoritative helper for resolving output directories/paths (default ./outputs, override via OUTPUT_DIR env var) and prevents any absolute /outputs usage.
Unit tests validating OUTPUT_DIR override behavior, default ./outputs resolution, directory creation semantics, and rejection of absolute /outputs targets.
Repository guard test that fails if any tracked source/test code attempts to write to an absolute /outputs path.
CI workflow that installs dependencies and runs the test suite on push/pull_request to enforce standardized output-path behavior.
Pytest configuration enabling consistent test discovery and output for CI runs.
Documentation describing the standardized output path policy, OUTPUT_DIR environment variable, and migration guidance away from absolute /outputs.

missionDescription: Standardize output path resolution across the codebase: implement a single output-path helper (defaults to ./outputs, optional OUTPUT_DIR env var) and refactor the pipeline/tests to use it exclusively; eliminate any attempts to write to absolute /outputs.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
Multiple execution agents reported that absolute /outputs is not writable, causing inconsistent artifact locations. A unified resolver is required for stable, reviewable deliverables.
